Row.Text: Commission the Heroons

The renown and glory of our heroes transcends death and continues to support and protect the living. Let us offer sacrifice as we feast and construct heroon to honour our dead![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Pergamon [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have constructed 2 Temples [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have a Military Unit at Level 4 or higher [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrate [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A 'We Love the King Day' is triggered in all Cities with a Temple

The renown and glory of our heroes transcends death and continues to support and protect the living. Let us offer sacrifice as we feast and construct heroon to honour our dead![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A 'We Love the King Day' is triggered in all Cities with a Temple
Build the Pergamon Altar

Hm. I think an Altar would go great with this carpet. Let's name it after ourselves.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Pergamon. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have researched Mathematics. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates. [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Pergamon Altar will be constructed in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.

Hm. I think an Altar would go great with this carpet. Let's name it after ourselves.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Pergamon Altar will be constructed in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
Pergamon Altar
Doubles current influence level with city states. Contains 1 slot for a Great Work of Art.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be acquired by Pergamon through the "Establish the Academy" decision.

The Pergamon Altar is a monumental construction built during the reign of King Eumenes II in the first half of the 2nd century BC on one of the terraces of the acropolis of the ancient city of Pergamon in Asia Minor. The Pergamene kingdom, founded by Philetaerus at the beginning of the 3rd century BC, was initially part of the Hellenistic Seleucid empire. Attalus I, successor and nephew of Eumenes I, was the first to achieve full independence for the territory and proclaimed himself king after his victory over the Celtic Galatians in 228 BC. His son, Eumenes II, further limited the influence of the Galatians and ruled jointly with his brother Attalos II, who succeeded him.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The altar structure is 35.64 meters wide and 33.4 meters deep; the front stairway alone is almost 20 meters wide. The base is decorated with a frieze in high relief showing the battle between the Giants and the Olympian gods known as the Gigantomachy. There is a second, smaller and less well preserved high relief frieze on the inner court walls which surround the actual fire altar on the upper level of the structure at the top of the stairs. It depicts, in a series of consecutive scenes, events from the life of Telephos, legendary founder of the city of Pergamon and son of the hero Heracles and Auge, a daughter of the Tegean king Aleus.
Call the Greeks to War!

A neighboring prince has stolen our beloved wife from the palace, taking her to the capital of their empire. Such a deed must not go unpunished and must be met with a show of force from all the Greek states![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Sparta [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be at War [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must be Friendly with or able to demand Tribute from at least 1 City-State [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrate [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive 1 Military Unit from every City-State with which you are at least Friendly or able to demand Tribute

A neighboring prince has stolen our beloved wife from the palace, taking her to the capital of their empire. Such a deed must not go unpunished and must be met with a show of force from all the Greek states![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive 1 Military Unit from every City-State with which you are at least Friendly or able to demand Tribute
Institute the Krypteia

The Ephors have heard whispers of revolution among the helots. To combat these malcontents, the best of the Spartiates shall be trained in the arts of secret warfare. They will hunt down the rebels in shadows where they lurk. As any helot might harbor such sentiments, all will be subject to the swift judgement of the kryptes.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Sparta [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have researched Bronze Working [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num} turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]-25% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from the number of your Cities [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Courthouses provide +15 XP for newly trained Units

The Ephors have heard whispers of revolution among the helots. To combat these malcontents, the best of the Spartiates shall be trained in the arts of secret warfare. They will hunt down the rebels in shadows where they lurk. As any helot might harbor such sentiments, all will be subject to the swift judgement of the kryptes.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]-25% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from the number of your Cities [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Courthouses provide +15 XP for newly trained Units
Relocate the Delian Treasury

{1_Capital} as the greatest city in the Delian League is surely the safest place for our funds; why not move the treasury there for security? Such a move would also have the side effect of giving us much greater control over our allies, effectively establishing an Athenian empire; but they don’t need to know that, do they?[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Athens [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must have a Gymnasium in one of their cities [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must be allied with at least 4 City-States [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]-15 [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with all allied City-States [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 {2_Resource} [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{3_Gold} [ICON GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per Allied City-State

{1_Capital} as the greatest city in the Delian League is surely the safest place for our funds; why not move the treasury there for security? Such a move would also have the side effect of giving us much greater control over our allies, effectively establishing an Athenian empire; but they don’t need to know that, do they?[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][ICON GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per Allied City-State
Establish the Academy

Our renowned philosophers and scientists are the envy of the civilised world! Let us construct a great Academy to give them grounds to further their knowledge, and foster this great tradition![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Athens. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates. [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Academy will be constructed in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Note: The [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost increases with each city that you own.[ENDCOLOR]

Our renowned philosophers and scientists are the envy of the civilised world! Let us construct a great Academy to give them grounds to further their knowledge, and foster this great tradition![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Academy will be constructed in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
The Academy

+15% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science. Provides +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for each allied City State, and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in every city with a Gymnasium. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be acquired by Athens through the "Establish the Academy" decision.

What was later to be known as Plato's school probably originated around the time Plato acquired inherited property at the age of thirty, with informal gatherings which included Theaetetus of Sunium, Archytas of Tarentum, Leodamas of Thasos, and Neoclides. According to Debra Nails, Speusippus "joined the group in about 390 BC". She claims, "It is not until Eudoxus of Cnidos arrives in the mid-380s BC that Eudemus recognizes a formal Academy." There is no historical record of the exact time the school was officially founded, but modern scholars generally agree that the time was the mid-380s, probably sometime after 387 BC, when Plato is thought to have returned from his first visit to Italy and Sicily. Originally, the location of the meetings was on Plato's property as often as it was the nearby Academy gymnasium; this remained so throughout the fourth century.

War never changes, but tactics do. The old hoplite formation is obsolete and no longer fit for the fields of battle. We should make use of the sarissa pike and instruct our warriors to wield it with skill and in unison.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Macedon [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have at least 5 Spearmen [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have researched Iron Working [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All Spearmen are instantly upgraded to Phalangitai and gain the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]"Phalanx"[ENDCOLOR] Promotion

War never changes, but tactics do. The old hoplite formation is obsolete and no longer fit for the fields of battle. We should make use of the sarissa pike and instruct our warriors to wield it with skill and in unison.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All Spearmen are instantly upgraded to Phalangitai and gain the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]"Phalanx"[ENDCOLOR] Promotion
Hellenise the Empire

Our Hellenic culture is clearly superior to that of these barbarians we’ve just conquered. We should spread our culture to our new conquests and demonstrate its supremacy![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Macedon [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have at least one Conquered City [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have {1_ReligionPrereq} [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have reached the Classical Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Courthouses will provide +2 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age points [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Conquered Cities following your Religion will provide an additional +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Note: The [ICON_GOLD] Gold cost increases based on your total number of Conquered Cities.[ENDCOLOR]

Our Hellenic culture is clearly superior to that of these barbarians we’ve just conquered. We should spread our culture to our new conquests and demonstrate its supremacy![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Courthouses will provide +2 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age points [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Conquered Cities following your Religion will provide an additional +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture
Sparta Decision Dummy
-25% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from the number of your Cities.
This building cannot be constructed but rather facilitates Sparta's unique abilities.

In ancient Sparta, the Krypteia was a state institution involving young Spartan men. Its goal and nature was a kind of secret police and state security organized by the ruling classes of Sparta whose purpose was to terrorize the servile helot population.
Eleusinian Mysteries
A mysterious new cult has appeared in your capital. Their secretive practices are causing some concerns amongst outsiders, who are requesting you take action.
We will outlaw the cult and punish those who participate!

[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Your Religion loses 2 followers in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]A 'We Love the King Day' is triggered in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR]
A mystery cult has appeared in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital!
We must allow them to practice their religion in peace.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]1 turn of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+50 [ICON_PEACE] Faith[ENDCOLOR]
A mystery cult has appeared in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital!
Olympic Games

The greatest sporting competition in all of Greece is nearly upon us. The Olympic Games promise glory and honour for the champions and their nations. We must decide our level of involvement in this year's games.
Sponsor an athlete!

[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_iCost} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]25% chance to suffer 1 turn of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]75% chance to enter a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age[ENDCOLOR]
We have sent athletes to compete in the Olympic Games!
Send an envoy!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_iCost} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital celebrates a 'We Love the King Day'[ENDCOLOR]
We have sent an envoy to represent us at the Olympic Games.
We will not participate this time
[ICON_BULLET]No effect
We have chosen not to participate in the Olympics Games.
Mount Olympus
Your citizens are flocking to the city of {1_CityDesc}, due to a rapidly spreading belief that a nearby mountain is home to the pantheon of gods.[NEWLINE]
Adopt the belief into our dogma!
Let them believe what they want, the pilgrims are good for the economy!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+3 [ICON_PEACE] Faith in the city, Trade Routes with the city produce +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in the city, Trade Routes with the city produce +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.[ENDCOLOR]
MC: Mount Olympus dummy faith option
MC: Mount Olympus dummy gold option
Thesmophoria
The women of {1_iName} have gathered together to honour Demeter in the time honoured tradition of Thesmophoria, hoping to garner the blessing of the goddess and ensure a bountiful harvest.
Let us hope that their actions please Demeter!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+25% [ICON_FOOD] Growth in {1_iName} for 10 turns[ENDCOLOR]
We have performed the Thesmophoria to honour the goddess Demeter!
Delphic Oracle

Faced with invasion from foreign hordes, we have sought an audience with Apollo's Oracle in Delphi, to provide divine guidance through these times. The Oracle has told us that either our king must fall in battle, or our city will.
Very well, I shall lead my troops to war.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]A Great General appears near your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR]
You have consulted the oracle of Apollo!
Bah, our men will fall to no army!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]1 turn of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]All current Units gain +15 XP[ENDCOLOR]
You have consulted the oracle of Apollo!
Delphic Oracle

Faced with invasion from foreign hordes, we have sought an audience with Apollo's Oracle in Delphi, to provide divine guidance through these times. The Oracle has told us that our wooden walls will protect us and our children - it is up to us to determine what this cryptic message means.
It clearly means the walls of Athens!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Walls will provide an additional +10 HP[ENDCOLOR]
You have consulted the oracle of Apollo!
The Oracle speaks of our famed navy!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]All current Naval Units gain +10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength[ENDCOLOR]
You have consulted the oracle of Apollo!
Delphic Oracle
+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength
Athens Event Dummy
+10 City HP.
This building cannot be constructed but rather facilitates Athen's unique abilities.

The Pythia, commonly known as the Oracle of Delphi, was the name of any priestess throughout the history of Temple of Apollo at Delphi, located on the slopes of Mount Parnassus, beneath the Castalian Spring.
Socrates

A philosopher by the name of Socrates has been frequenting the public areas of our capital, influencing young minds and troubling old ones with his views on the universe. We must decide what do with him.
Let him practice in peace!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Gymnasia[ENDCOLOR]
Socrates has been teaching in your capital!
He must be sentenced to death for blasphemy!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]20% chance your empire enters 1 turn of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+200 [ICON_PEACE] Faith[ENDCOLOR]
Socrates has been teaching in your capital!
Athens Decision Dummy
Athens Decision Dummy
+2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness. +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Libraries.
The Dying Gaul

After many battles against the barbarians, we have proven victorious. The bravest of these warriors challenged us wearing nothing but their weapons. Our court sculptors now seek to commemorate our victory and the valor of enemies.
We shall honour the victory through great sculptures!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Receive the Great Artist Epigonus[ENDCOLOR]
You have commissioned a sculpture from the Great Artist Epigonus!
Honour the victory on the friezes of our temples!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Wonders[ENDCOLOR]
You have adorned your temples with scenes from your many victories!
Epigonus

Our people are now debating pholosophical theories and practicing democracy! I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
Our people are now weilding sarissa and conquering vast swathes of land! I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
Our people are now eating syssita and following strict military codes! I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
Our people are now building great monuments and protecting lesser states! I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
